Lyrion Media Server - Latest Stable.description:
Lyrion Media Server (formerly known as Logitech Media Server, Squeezebox, slimserver, etc.). Latest stable version. For future updates see more information icon after first installation.

Based on a official community docker image: https://hub.docker.com/r/lmscommunity/logitechmediaserver, available for amd64 and arm64 architecture.
Lyrion Media Server - Latest Stable.more_info:
Update to newer version

Due to some current limitations in rock-on networking, the web UI port of this rock-on must be set as 9000 and will thus prevent the installation of other rock-ons needing this port. Alternatively, the web UI can be accessed manually at http://rockstor-ip:9000

After first installation: to update to a newer stable version, either uninstall/reinstall the Rockon or use the Watchtower Rockon to manage the update of the underlying Media Server image, as it does not automatically update itself during a stop/restart of the Rockon like some other Rockons do. Don't use the update option within the LMS!

The LMS configuration files will remain in place on the volumes that were specified during the initial installation

9000.description: WebUI port. This MUST be set to 9000
9000.label: WebUI port

9090.description: Command Line Interface (used for example by Android app Squeezer). This MUST be set to 9090
9090.label: CLI port

3483.description: control channel for LMS (display, IR, etc.), tcp and udp (SB --> Slimserver discovery and for older SLIMP3 players). Suggested Default: 3483
3483.label: Control Channel

/config.description: Choose a Share for LMS configuration. E.g.: create a Share called lms-config for this purpose alone.
/config.label: Config Storage

/music.description: Choose a Share for LMS content(your media). E.g.: create a Share called lms-music for this purpose alone. You can also assign other media Shares on the system after installation.
/music.label: Media Storage

/playlist.description: Choose a Share for LMS Playlists. E.g.: create a Share called lms-playlist for this purpose alone. You can also assign other media Shares on the system after installation.
/playlist.label: Playlist Storage

PUID.description: Enter a valid User ID (UID) to run Lyrion Media Server with. It must have full permissions to all Shares mapped in the previous step.
PUID.label: UID

PGID.description: Enter a valid Group ID (GID) to use along with the above UID. It(or the above UID) must have full permissions to all Shares mapped in the previous step.
PGID.label: GID
